lead_paragraph: The Heat traded Antoine Walker, a three-time All-Star forward, to the Minnesota Timberwolves yesterday in a five-player deal that came a day after Miami ended a winless preseason.The Heat sent Walker, the backup center Michael Doleac, forward Wayne Simien and a conditional first-round draft pick to Minnesota for the former Miami swingman Ricky Davis and center Mark Blount.With Davis, Miami receives a third scoring option behind Shaquille O’Neal and Dwyane Wade. The Timberwolves have only three players who have been with the team more than one season: Mark Madsen, Rashad McCants and Marko Jaric.
